head.title: World Business Briefing | Europe: Russia: Gazprom Seeks U.S. Stake

hedline.hl1: World Business Briefing | Europe: Russia: Gazprom Seeks U.S. Stake

abstract.p: Gazprom, world's largest natural gas producer, signals its intent to take stake in liquefied natural gas terminal; venture will provide Gazprom with outlet in US for natural gas from its Shtokman field in Barents Sea above Arctic Circle (S)

block.p: Gazprom, the world's largest natural gas producer, signaled its intent yesterday to take a stake in a liquefied natural gas terminal. Alexander Medvedev, the deputy chairman of Gazprom, which is also Russia's largest company, said in an interview that such a venture would provide Gazprom with an outlet in the United States for natural gas from its Shtokman field in the Barents Sea above the Arctic Circle. Mr. Medvedev said Gazprom was discussing the plan with the companies vying to take part in the Arctic project, which include two American concerns, Chevron and ConocoPhillips; two Norwegian companies, Statoil and Norsk Hydro; and Total of France.
